options.content:
Build Performance

CloudBees CI on Modern | Enterprise Jenkins running on Kubernetes

Designed and tested for CloudBees CI EKS Blueprint: Jenkins at scale

Notes

  • Datasources: Prometheus, Tempo
  • Metrics: Jenkins Metrics plugin formatted by CloudBees Prometheus Plugin, OpenTelemetry plugin
  • Tracing: OpenTelemetry plugin
  • The Dashboard is compatible with CloudBees CI HA/HS

panels.title: Jenkins | Overview of Current Status (by Service)

panels.description:
Comparison of build completion status' within specified time interval.

Success: The Build has no errors, and completed.

Failure: The Build had a fatal error, and did not complete.

Aborted: The Build was interrupted before it reaches its expected end. For example, the user has stopped it manually or there was a time-out.

Unstable: The Build had some errors but they were not fatal. The build completed.

Not Built: The Build was scheduled but cancelled and not started. This could be due to manual intervention or concurrent builds are not allowed.
panels.title: Build Completion Status

panels.description:
Average time spent in the building.

Build: Total time spent executing the build.

Total: Time spent in the queue as well as completing the build.
panels.title: Average Build Time

panels.description:
Average time spent in the queue.

Queuing: Total time spent in the queue before build starting.

Waiting: Time spent in the quiet period.

Blocked: Cause could be target label is busy, target node is offline, target node is busy, target label is offline.
panels.title: Average Queue Time

panels.description: Number of builds during the time period.
panels.title: Total Number of Builds

panels.description: Prometheus Build Performance data resets all metrics back to 0 when a controller restarts.
